Lincolnshire – GLL to take over surviving 15 council-run libraries. Further £500k cut suggested.
Swindon – Considering cut of "a least 75%" (£1.5m) to libraries budget, to be closed or passed to volunteers/parish councils.
Angus – Libraries passed to Angusalive, joint leisure/culture/libraries non-profit trust. Late fines abolished.

Bradford – 19 out of 30 Bradford Libraries will become volunteer or close. (note on figures: report says 25 out of 32 but this includes 2 local studies libraries which I don’t count separately and 4 libraries I already have listed as volunteer)
Croydon – Deep cuts to library service expected, with volunteers and others suggested as alternatives.
Derby – Considers Open+ remote controlled opening, volunteers and co-locations to cut costs.
Worcestershire – £475k cut 2016/17, with money being gained by hiring out library space to other agencies.
Birmingham – £250k investment by Wolfson Foundation into five children’s libraries.
Croydon – 9 of 13 libraries under threat. £217k cut p.a.
Derbyshire – New £892k library opened at Heanor, including health and wellbeing zone.
Falkirk – £432k cut.: 17 FTE posts to be lost, mobile library lost, bookfund cut, events at risk.
East Sussex – Library opening hours to be reduced by around 25%: £500k p.a. cut.
Fife – 16 libraries confirmed to close. £571 cut p.a.
Lancashire – Charges increase – adults 15p per day book late up to £6 maximum, children’s crafts will be charged £1 per child (max £2 per family)

Future of council-run libraries under threat after £50m slashed from budgets – LocalGov. "Funding for council-run libraries was slashed by £50m over the last year bringing into question their long-term sustainability"
Leicestershire – Sileby Library now run by volunteers
Pembrokeshire – Narberth Library under threat: more volunteers or danger of closure.

Fife – 16 libraries confirmed to close. £571 cut p.a.

Birmingham – £250k investment by Wolfson Foundation into five children’s libraries.

Bradford – 19 out of 30 Bradford Libraries will become volunteer or close. (note on figures: report says 25 out of 32 but this includes 2 local studies libraries which I don’t count separately and 4 libraries I already have listed as volunteer)
Angus – Libraries passed to Angusalive, joint leisure/culture/libraries non-profit trust. Late fines abolished.
Somerset – Many libraries being re-located or merged with other services.
Suffolk – Lowestoft Library café closes as losing money.
Argyll and Bute – Considering removing school librarians.
East Lothian – (One) mobile library suspended until at least April.
Swindon – Community radio station to move into Liden Library.
